description: Chef Monirul is a master of Bangladeshi cuisine, with over 10 years of experience creating delicious dishes.

recipes.name: Hilsha Fish Curry
instructions: Marinate the fish with turmeric powder and salt
Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the fish until golden brown
In the same pan, add chopped onion, garlic, ginger, and green chili and saute for a few minutes
Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, and cumin powder and fry for a minute
Add chopped tomato and cook until the oil separates
Add water and bring it to a boil
Add the fried fish and cook for 10-15 minutes
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves

recipes.name: Chitol Macher Kalia
instructions: Marinate the fish with turmeric powder and salt
Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the fish until golden brown
In the same pan, add chopped onion, garlic, ginger, and green chili and saute for a few minutes
Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, and cumin powder and fry for a minute
Add chopped tomato and cook until the oil separates
Add water and bring it to a boil
Add the fried fish and cook for 10-15 minutes
Add garam masala and cook for another 2-3 minutes
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves

recipes.name: Pabda Macher Jhal
instructions: Marinate the fish with turmeric powder and salt
Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the fish until golden brown
In the same pan, add chopped onion, garlic, ginger, and green chili and saute for a few minutes
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and cumin powder and fry for a minute
Add chopped tomato and cook until the oil separates
Add water and bring it to a boil
Add the fried fish and cook for 10-15 minutes
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves

description: Chef Sadia is a rising star in the world of Bangladeshi cuisine, with a talent for combining traditional and modern flavors.

recipes.name: Beef Bhuna
instructions: Marinate the beef with turmeric powder and salt
Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the beef until brown
In the same pan, add chopped onion, garlic, ginger, and green chili and saute for a few minutes
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and cumin powder and fry for a minute
Add chopped tomato and cook until the oil separates
Add water and bring it to a boil
Add the fried beef and cook for 20-30 minutes
Add garam masala and cook for another 2-3 minutes
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves

recipes.name: Mutton Rezala
instructions: Marinate the mutton with yogurt, turmeric powder, and salt
Grind cashew nuts and poppy seeds to a fine paste
Heat ghee in a pan and fry the mutton until brown
In the same pan, add chopped onion, garlic, ginger, and green chili and saute for a few minutes
Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, and cumin powder and fry for a minute
Add the ground paste and fry for a few minutes
Add water and bring it to a boil
Add garam masala and cook for 20-30 minutes
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves

recipes.name: Chicken Korma
instructions: Marinate the chicken with yogurt, turmeric powder, and salt
Grind cashew nuts and poppy seeds to a fine paste
Heat ghee in a pan and fry the chicken until brown
In the same pan, add chopped onion, garlic, ginger, and green chili and saute for a few minutes
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and cumin powder and fry for a minute
Add the ground paste and fry for a few minutes
Add water and bring it to a boil
Add garam masala and cook for 20-30 minutes
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves

description: Chef Imran is a seasoned veteran of the Bangladeshi culinary scene, with a passion for using fresh, locally-sourced ingredients.

recipes.name: Rui Maach Bhaja
instructions: Marinate the fish with turmeric powder and salt
Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the fish until golden brown

recipes.name: Chingri Bhuna
instructions: Marinate the prawns with turmeric powder and salt
Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the prawns until brown
In the same pan, add chopped onion, garlic, ginger, and green chili and saute for a few minutes
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and cumin powder and fry for a minute
Add chopped tomato and cook until the oil separates
Add water and bring it to a boil
Add the fried prawns and cook for 5-10 minutes
Add garam masala and cook for another 2-3 minutes
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves

recipes.name: Hilsa Curry
instructions: Marinate the fish with turmeric powder and salt
Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the fish until brown
In the same pan, add chopped onion, garlic, ginger, and green chili and saute for a few minutes
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and cumin powder and fry for a minute
Add chopped tomato and cook until the oil separates
Add water and bring it to a boil
Add the fried fish and cook for 10-15 minutes
Add garam masala and cook for another 2-3 minutes
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves

description: Chef Nasrin is known for her creative twists on traditional Bangladeshi dishes, and her innovative use of spices and flavors.

recipes.name: Bhetki Paturi
instructions: Marinate the fish with mustard paste, coconut paste, green chili paste, turmeric powder, and salt
Wrap the fish in a banana leaf and tie with a string
Steam the fish for 15-20 minutes
Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the fish until the leaf turns brown
Serve hot with steamed rice

recipes.name: Mishti Doi
instructions: Boil milk in a pan and let it cool down to room temperature
Add sugar and yogurt to the milk and mix well
Pour the mixture into earthen pots and cover with a lid
Place the pots in a warm place and let it set for 6-8 hours
Refrigerate the pots for a few hours before serving

recipes.name: Chomchom
instructions: Mix milk powder and all-purpose flour in a bowl
Add water and knead the mixture until it becomes a smooth dough
Divide the dough into small balls and roll them into cylindrical shapes
Boil sugar and water in a pan and add rosewater and cardamom powder
Add the cylindrical balls to the syrup and cook for 15-20 minutes
Garnish with chopped pistachios

description: Chef Abdul is a legend in the Bangladeshi culinary world, with decades of experience creating unforgettable dishes.

recipes.name: Firni
instructions: Boil milk in a pan and add rice flour to it
Stir continuously to avoid lumps
Add sugar and cardamom powder and cook until the mixture thickens
Pour the mixture into serving bowls and let it cool down to room temperature
Refrigerate the bowls for a few hours before serving
Garnish with chopped pistachios

recipes.name: Bhuna Khichuri
instructions: Soak rice and lentils in water for 30 minutes
Heat ghee in a pan and fry onions until golden brown
Add garlic, ginger, and green chili to the pan and fry for a minute
Add tomatoes and cook until they turn soft
Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and salt to the pan and fry for a minute
Add the soaked rice and lentils to the pan and stir well
Add enough water to cover the mixture and cook until the rice and lentils are soft and mushy
Serve hot with fried eggplant and fried onions

recipes.name: Shorshe Ilish
instructions: Clean and cut the hilsa fish into pieces
Make a paste with mustard seeds, green chili, turmeric powder, and salt
Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the fish pieces until golden brown
Remove the fish from the pan and keep aside
In the same pan, add the mustard paste and fry for a minute
Add enough water to cover the mixture and cook until the mixture thickens
Add the fish pieces to the pan and cook for a few minutes
Serve hot with steamed rice

description: Chef Farzana is a young talent with a passion for using fresh, seasonal ingredients to create healthy and delicious Bangladeshi dishes.

recipes.name: Mutton Rezala
instructions: Heat ghee in a pan and fry onions until golden brown
Add garlic, ginger, and bay leaf to the pan and fry for a minute
Add mutton to the pan and fry until it turns brown
Add cardamom powder and cinnamon powder to the pan and fry for a minute
Make a paste with yogurt, poppy seeds, and cashews
Add the paste to the pan and stir well
Add enough water to cover the mixture and cook until the mutton is tender
Serve hot with naan or paratha

recipes.name: Kacchi Biryani
instructions: Marinate mutton with yogurt, green chili, and salt for at least 2 hours
Soak saffron in warm milk
Wash basmati rice and soak in water for 30 minutes
Heat ghee in a pot and fry onions until golden brown
Add garlic, ginger, and bay leaf to the pot and fry for a minute
Add mutton to the pot and fry until it turns brown
Add cardamom pods, cinnamon stick, and cloves to the pot and fry for a minute
Add enough water to cover the mixture and cook until the mutton is tender
Drain the soaked rice and add it to the pot
Pour the saffron milk over the rice
Cover the pot and cook on low heat until the rice is cooked and fluffy
Serve hot with raita and salad

recipes.name: Chingri Bhapa
instructions: Clean and devein the prawns
Make a paste with coconut milk, mustard paste, green chili, turmeric powder, and salt
Mix the prawns with the paste
Add the prawn mixture to a bowl and cover it with foil
Add water to a steamer and place the bowl in the steamer
Steam the prawn mixture for 20-25 minutes or until the prawns are cooked
Remove from the steamer and drizzle mustard oil over the top
Serve hot with steamed rice

description: Chef Shahed is a master of Bangladeshi cuisine, with a focus on using traditional techniques and ingredients to create authentic dishes.

recipes.name: Shami Kabab
instructions: Soak chana dal in water for 2-3 hours
Boil chana dal in salted water until it is soft and mushy
Heat oil in a pan and fry onions until golden brown
Add garlic and ginger to the pan and fry for a minute
Add ground beef to the pan and fry until it turns brown
Add garam masala, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt to the pan and fry for a minute
Add the boiled chana dal to the pan and stir well
Cook for a few minutes until the mixture is dry
Let the mixture cool down
Add egg and bread crumbs to the mixture and knead well
Shape the mixture into small patties
Heat oil in a pan and fry the patties until they are golden brown on both sides
Serve hot with mint chutney

recipes.name: Chingri Malai Curry
instructions: Clean and devein prawns
Heat oil in a pan and fry onions until golden brown
Add garlic, ginger, and green chili to the pan and fry for a minute
Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and red chili powder to the pan and fry for a minute
Add prawns to the pan and fry until they turn pink
Add coconut milk to the pan and stir well
Add salt to taste and let it cook for 5-7 minutes until the gravy thickens
Add garam masala to the pan and stir well
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves
Serve hot with steamed rice

recipes.name: Shorshe Ilish
instructions: Clean and cut the Hilsa fish into pieces
Marinate the fish with salt and turmeric powder for 15-20 minutes
Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the fish pieces until they are golden brown on both sides
Remove the fish pieces from the pan and keep them aside
Add onion, garlic, ginger, and green chili to the same pan and fry until the onions turn translucent
Add mustard paste and a little bit of water to the pan and stir well
Add salt to taste and let the gravy cook for a few minutes
Add the fried fish pieces to the pan and coat them well with the gravy
Let it cook for a few more minutes until the fish is fully cooked
Serve hot with steamed rice
